intro: Cadetia remotisepala, commonly known as the remote-sepal cadetia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a delicate, fern-like appearance. Cadetia remotisepala is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological niche.
